intro: Claytonia acutifolia, commonly known as the sharpleaf springbeauty, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. Claytonia acutifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in cool, temperate climates.
